page.title: 04AMENITIES IN EARDISLEY
page.content: In the centre of Eardisley is the {village hall}called Curzon Herrick Hall.It was built in 1901 on land given by Mrs. Curzon Herrick.Canon C.S.Palmer gave money for the building The hall seats 120 people.It costs Â£600 a year to run.It is used for many events,meetings,whists drives,concerts discos,pantomimes and sales.An extension is being built to the hall. It will cost Â£18,000.In 1983 a festival raised Â£5000.Another festival is planned for Aug.1985.The caretaker of the hall lives nearby. The{Fire Station}was opened in 1966 .There are 9 retained firemen.The old way of calling the men to a fire was by a siren on top of the tower outside the station.Now the men have bleepers ,little blue boxes,which they carry with them.When there is a fire the box bleeps and they rush to the station.
